meanings.definition: A secondary or incidental product or result.
meanings.sent1: The factory's byproducts included excess packaging materials.
meanings.sent2: The bakery's byproducts were the leftover bread crusts and crumbs.
meanings.sent3: The byproducts of the party were the forgotten party favors.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was a byproduct of his silly jokes.
meanings.sent5: The byproducts of her hard work were evident in the successful project outcome.

meanings.definition: Something produced in the course of making something else.
meanings.sent1: The sawdust created during woodworking is considered a byproduct.
meanings.sent2: The sparks from welding are common byproducts of the process.
meanings.sent3: The byproducts of their conversation were the shared memories.
meanings.sent4: His smile was a byproduct of her kind words.
meanings.sent5: The byproducts of their collaboration were seen in the innovative design.
